summary: Apple's stock price is down 19% on the year . It's facing a Department of Justice antitrust probe . The company delayed its improved Siri until later this year and is still trying to catch up to competitors . President Trump is now coming for the iPhone .  Trump threatened to hit Apple's iPhone with a 25% tariff if Cook doesn't move production to the US . Apple largely avoided Trump's initial round of "Liberation Day" tariffs and subsequent increased levies .  Apple is shifting production of iPhones and other hardware to India, Vietnam, and other regions . Building an iPhone in the US would not only require a Herculean effort to pull off during Trump's term but also add hundreds of dollars to iPhone prices .  An iPhone built in the US would likely cost 35% more than one built in China or India . That would send the cost of an iPhone 16 Pro from $999 to $1,350 . But if Apple decides to accept the 25% tariff as is, Morgan Stanley's Erik Woodring estimates the company would only need to increase global iPhone prices by 4% to 6%.  Apple has the opportunity to change the narrative around its AI offerings during its WWDC developer event on June 9 . Apple is expected to show off the latest versions of its operating systems, including iOS 19 and iPadOS 19, as well as the next iteration of its macOS .  The Justice Department filed its antitrust suit against Apple in March 2024 . The suit says Apple has an illegal monopoly in the smartphone market . A loss in the case could force Apple to open up its walled garden .  Apple also continues to contend with the fallout from its antitrust legal fight with Epic Games . A judge ruled that Apple had to provide app developers with options to make app purchases outside of Apple's App Store . The judge is asking prosecutors to look into Apple's moves to review the alleged "cover-up"  Read the latest financial and business news from Yahoo Finance . and expectations, and company earnings news, click here to read . and . share your company's earnings news .

Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT)-backedOpenAI's new public benefit corporationstructure gets us to an IPO-able event, CFO Sarah Friar said at the Dublin Tech Summit . Friar stressed that the PBC modelcombining a nonprofit parent with a for-profit LLCaligns shareholder interests with OpenAI's mission, and gives the firm flexibility to pursue an IPO if and when we want to .  Markets will be watching for any timeline hints or structural updates that signal when the firm might officially file for an IPO . This article first appeared on GuruFocus.com .

SAP expanded its partnership with Microsoft to help drive enterprise adoption of the ERP provider’s Business Suite bundles . The integrations will connect SAP’ Joule AI assistant with the Microsoft 365 suite of productivity tools . Microsoft also extended its Sentra, Defender and Entra security tools .  The bundled offerings are designed to ease migrations by targeting function-specific business processes . Microsoft is the first hyperscaler to offer the Business Suite Accelerator program . SAP recently expanded existing pacts with AWS and Google Cloud to ease the flow of ERP data across clouds .  SAP Business Data Cloud will be deployed in three Google Cloud regions in later this year . SAP was among thefirst to sign on to Google Cloud’sAgent2Agent open protocol for multi-agent AI orchestration .  “This will accelerate their transformation into an AI-driven enterprise,” the companies said in the announcement . “Analysts will be able to streamline their workflows, and accelerate their . analytical workflows.”

BoxBOX reported first-quarter fiscal 2026 non-GAAP earnings of 30 cents per share (including 1 cent of unfavorable forex impacts) declined 23.1% year over year . The figure exceeded the Zacks Consensus Estimate by 20%. Total revenues of $276.3 million surpassed the consensus mark by 0.67% .  Box's net retention rate was 102% at the end of the fiscal first quarter, up 100 bps year over year . The company generated 61% of its revenues from Suite’s customers in the first quarter of fiscal 2026 .  Box generated $127.1 million in cash from operations in the fiscal first quarter . The company recorded an operating margin of 25.3%, which contracted 130 bps year over year . Box repurchased 1.6 million shares for $50 million in first-quarter fiscal 2026 .  Box expects revenues between $290 million and $291 million, suggesting an 8% rise from the prior-year reported figure . The cc growth rate is pegged at 6%, this includes an expected positive impact of approximately 220 basis points due to FX . The non-GAAP operating margin for the fiscal second quarter is expected to be 28%.  PagerDuty shares have lost 11.3% year to date . PD is set to report its first-quarter fiscal 2026 results on May 29 . GitLab’s shares have also lost 14.8% year-to-date .

Telecom specialist Lumen Technologies will sell its mass markets fiber business to AT&T for $5.75 billion . The telecom will likely use the proceeds to reduce debt and invest in its network . Lumen is pivoting toward business and away from the consumer market .  As of the first quarter of 2025, Lumen holds $17.3 billion in long-term debt . The company has to build what it calls a "backbone" for artificial intelligence to serve its enterprise customers .  In the first quarter of 2025, revenue dropped 3% year over year to $3.2 billion . Despite a net loss of $201 million, Lumen generated $354 million infree cash flow in Q1 . The stock is up 200% over the past year but down 64% from its peak in November .  Prospects for a turnaround have improved thanks to AI partnerships, and the cash infusion from the sale of the consumer fiber business greatly increases the odds of a turnaround . Lumen's revenue continues to fall, and forecasts indicate that trend will continue through 2025 and 2026 . Russian hackers are targeting critical infrastructure organizations in multiple sectors to collect intelligence for Moscow, Microsoft and Dutch intelligence services say . The group has been using stolen credentials and automated bulk-email collection from cloud services to scoop up data on NATO member states and Ukraine .  Laundry Bear has targeted defense contractors, aerospace companies, and other firms that produce military equipment . Dutch intelligence agencies said the threat group appears to have inside information about the supply chain of the companies manufacturing weapons for Ukraine . Microsoft has seen the group targeting an even wider range of firms, including in the communications, healthcare, education, media, nonprofit and transportation sectors .  Laundry Bear “has successfully managed to fly below the radar by employing simple attack methods and attack vectors involving tools which are readily available on victims’ computers, Dutch government says . Group “abuses legitimate cloud APIs” to list and exfiltrate data from any mailboxes available .  Laundry Bear’s tactics have been evolving, Microsoft says . In April, the group started crafting unique spear-phishing messages to steal targets’ passwords . Dutch government says the hackers have targeted companies producing technologies that are currently off limits to Russia .  Google says Laundry Bear's activity-logging is effective defense techniques for blocking and detecting threat actors . Analyst: "The criminal ecosystem is a powerful force multiplier for Russian cyber espionage actors"

CoreWeave shares have soared 200% year to date, defying the broader market's weakness . The artificial intelligence infrastructure specialist posted jaw-dropping 420% revenue growth in the first quarter . Wall Street analysts expect its revenue to more than double in 2026 .  CoreWeave is a cloud computing provider that operates data centers designed specifically for AI workloads . With more than 33 facilities across the U.S. and Europe, it provides a variety of computational horsepower needed to power a host of AI-related needs .  CoreWeave has a massive $25.9 billion revenue backlog, which includes $14.7 billion in remaining performance obligations . With 420 megawatts (MW) powering its data centers across the U.S. and Europe, the company has the physical infrastructure to support years of double-digit percentage growth .  CoreWeave's competitive advantage stems from its purpose-built approach . Traditional cloud providers likeAmazonWeb Services orMicrosoftAzure retrofit existing data centers for AI workloads . The company posted a loss of $314.6 million in Q1, widening from $129.2 million a year earlier .  CoreWeave is spending roughly five times its annual revenue on its infrastructure build-out . Microsoft alone accounted for 62% of its 2024 revenue . Analysts project the company will turn profitable in 2026 while maintaining triple-digit growth rates . Microsoft pulled the plug on planned data centers in Ohiolast month and a Wells Fargo report suggested Amazon wasreconsidering some leases . The question isn’t whether AI infrastructure demand is real — it’s whether the real estate market and power grid can handle it .  75% to 85% of new data center capacity through 2029 is already pre-leased, says Andy Cvengros . Microsoft, Google, Amazon, and Amazon planning to spend more than $300 billion this year alone .  Microsoft’s Satya Nadelladismissed data center adjustmentsas routine business that simply gets more attention now . Cvengros says hyperscalers are “pausing to re-architect their strategy, ultimately to continue doing what they’re doing in a large way”  New facilities are regularly requesting 500 megawatts or more — enough to power hundreds of thousands of homes . In Virginia alone, the state’s largest utility has connected 75 new data centers since 2019 .  Traditional grid buildout takes four to seven years under normal circumstances . Supply chain bottlenecks have made the situation worse . EPRI’s DCFlex project is exploring how data centers can become grid resources .  Data center growth is outpacing grid capacity and straining local power supplies . Cities have imposed energy moratoriums, others have implemented new sustainability requirements . The difference in approaches reflects deeper philosophical divides, Weynandt says .  Each power study generates a formal request to utilities for grid capacity, creating an avalanche of applications . The situation has become so distorted that utilities now see 30 to 100 gigawatts of power requests in individual markets .  Companies are buying entire neighborhoods, paying residents well above market rates to relocate . This is happening more and more in core locations, such as Chicago’s Elk Grove Village . Companies are moving outward to new markets such as Columbus and Minneapolis .  Nvidia’s roadmap showsfuture server racks will consume 600 kilowattseach — a 30-fold increase from the 10-20k standard that prevailed for the past two decades . Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang has signaled that while chips will be more efficient, they’ll also be more powerful and require more energy .  AI-powered search results could multiply exponentially if AI applications reach broader adoption . The companies navigating this transition successfully will be those with real business models and deep pockets, not land speculators . “I don’t necessarily see a bubble popping.”

Bill Gates would be worth around $1.2 trillion if he'd never sold a single share or donated a dime . The clip estimates that he andMelinda French Gatescould have had a combined fortune of $1 .5 trillion .  If they'd never sold and reinvested dividends, the Gateses would own over 3.2 billion shares after stock splits, controlling about 43% of Microsoft . Today, he holds less than 1% of the Microsoft stock, worth about $28 billion . Wired magazine predicted Gates would become the first trillionaire by 2005 .  Gates co-founded the Gates Foundation with Melinda in 2000 . He's given away more than $100 billion through the foundation . Gates could've been the world's first trillionaire but chose to focus on philanthropy instead .
